page.title: 07The Southdown Fair - 1
page.content: The Southdown Fair is owned and run by the {Harris}family, being we believe the last'true'family-run fair in Sussex today.The Harris' have lived in Ashington since 1907, in caravans, on 2.4 acres of land on which they store their Fair. Their grandfather started the Fair around 1870 and his son carried it on. The whole family help run the Fair,{Robert Harris,}the manager, his four brothers{John, Ted, {Douglas and Fred.}Robert's wife and three sons also help as do other members of the immediate family. The Fair grew bigger after the 1st World War when the 'Galloping Horses' arrived; the same ride remains today as the oldest of 14 rides and sideshows at the Fair. The biggest change since the 2nd W.W. has been from steam to diesel. {(The Southdown Fair cont. on Page 8)
